title: Hatchy
author: Hatchy
created_time: May 21, 2023, 05:18:13 PMLast edit: May 27, 2023, 02:48:09 PM by Hatchy
content: It fills my heart, with great joy and gratitude as I write this post to share a significant milestone in my life.with the blessings and guidance of the Lord almighty, I have I have successfully completed my house project. This achievement is a testament to the power of faith, perseverance, and the unwavering support of my loved ones.In 2018, I embarked on a journey to build my dream home. It all began when I acquired a plot of land and started the construction process. Along the way I encountered numerous challenges and obstacles. The loss of my dear grandmother weighed heavily on my heart, and as the first son of my parents, I had additional responsibilities that put my project on hold. Despite these setbacks I never lost faith. I knew deep within my soul that God had a plan for me and I remained positive in my determination to see my house project through to completion.  April of this year marked a turning point in my life as I proudly rounded up the final touches and officially completed my house. It is a moment filled with overwhelming joy, gratitude, and a profound sense of accomplishment. I give all glory, to God for his grace  blessings bestowed upon me.I would like to take this opportunity to encourage each and every one of you to continue believing in God's divine plan for your lives. with the current situation of the country I know everything is not going as most of us had planned. but Whether you earn through your jobs, business ventures, or even cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, I urge you to exercise patience and trust in God. Time and again, I have witnessed how perseverance and faith can help us achieve our goals and exceed our expectations.I extend my appreciation to this our community here on Bitcointalk, where I can also share this personal milestone. May our shared experiences inspire and uplift one another as we navigate through life's challenges and pursue our dreams.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Op congratulations to you on your achievement it's nice seeing people achieve something tangible and in your case a house. But, to be honest, Op, I don't like the idea of coming to the forum to brag about your accomplishments. Before we all discovered this forum, we were all doing things and nothing happened to us even when we didn't announce it to the world. I get the impression that excitement is a driving force here, but I prefer the low-key approach, and aside from that, I've seen several cases where a user made an announcement that drew attention to himself and later got banned after some unacceptable activities were discovered in the user's history; I'm not saying this would happen, but it's better to be cautious when doing things in a forum that's filled with different people with different believes, just to be on the safer side. Once again Op, congratulations to you.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Congratulations OP. Any peso wey d build house now, talk more of completing at this time wey things d hard and d too expensive, dey need to give that peso big hand shake because sae em no d easy to build house from its foundation to its completion. I remember then when my parents d build our house years back, people d laugh at us by calling our house, one year, one block. Funny enough them no know sae as we d build am one year one block na so the house the go slow and steady to em finish. As we come build our house finish and pack inside am. Who d talk about the one year, one block again? No body. Na so life dey. People wey see result. Having said that, wetin I wan talk be sae, thank God you were able to push it through towards the end of your building project despite sae you losing your grandmother and other family responsibility wey you d solve. No be everybody go fit get the kind grace to finish up a gigantic building like yours to d end. Na why I d sae big congratulation to you because em no d easy mancha.

comments.body: Congratulations mate!Well, it is good seeing that our brother among us has something good to show his people and to also encourage us to put God and Faith first, because I know that many of us here have the dream of getting their own dream House but due to one challenge or other they might not put on that light shining on their side instead may decides to abandon it for another thing.Those who truly trust and believe in God for whatever they are doing always ends up with a high praise because it can only be HIM. I will like to say you should accept my condolences for the death of your granny and may her soul rest in perfect peace. I believe one day everyone must testify the good works of God in their lives.
